metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26759 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
clickhouse-driver before 0.1.5 allows a malicious clickhouse server to trigger a crash or execute arbitrary code (on a database client) via a crafted server response, due to a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-26759` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-clickhouse-driver - 0.2.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-clickhouse-driver package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.0-1').
